fields.title: Yemen Conflict - ETC Situation Report #79 (Reporting period: 01/04/2023 to 30/04/2023)
fields.body:
**Highlight**

- In April, the ETC provided data
connectivity services to 1,298
humanitarians and security
communications services to a total of
2,396 responders across 20 sites in
Yemen.

- A telecommunications specialist and
former WFP staff member, sponsored by
the ETC, arrived in Aden on 27 April to
provide telecommunications training to
UNDSS Security Operations Centre
(SOC) Operators in Aden, Marib, and Al
Mokha from 29 April to 15 May.

- The ETC set up dedicated bandwidth and Wi-Fi connectivity for the UN Mission to
support the Hodeidah Agreement (UNMHA) in Al-Mokha in response to their request and
needs.
fields.body-html:
Highlight

  • In April, the ETC provided data connectivity services to 1,298 humanitarians and security communications services to a total of 2,396 responders across 20 sites in Yemen.

  • A telecommunications specialist and former WFP staff member, sponsored by the ETC, arrived in Aden on 27 April to provide telecommunications training to UNDSS Security Operations Centre (SOC) Operators in Aden, Marib, and Al Mokha from 29 April to 15 May.

  • The ETC set up dedicated bandwidth and Wi-Fi connectivity for the UN Mission to support the Hodeidah Agreement (UNMHA) in Al-Mokha in response to their request and needs.

text:
# Yemen Conflict - ETC Situation Report #79 (Reporting period: 01/04/2023 to 30/04/2023)

**Highlight**

- In April, the ETC provided data
connectivity services to 1,298
humanitarians and security
communications services to a total of
2,396 responders across 20 sites in
Yemen.

- A telecommunications specialist and
former WFP staff member, sponsored by
the ETC, arrived in Aden on 27 April to
provide telecommunications training to
UNDSS Security Operations Centre
(SOC) Operators in Aden, Marib, and Al
Mokha from 29 April to 15 May.

- The ETC set up dedicated bandwidth and Wi-Fi connectivity for the UN Mission to
support the Hodeidah Agreement (UNMHA) in Al-Mokha in response to their request and
needs.
summary: In April, the ETC provided data connectivity services to 1,298 humanitarians and security communications services to 2,396 responders across 20 sites in Yemen. Additionally, a telecommunications specialist sponsored by the ETC arrived in Aden to provide training to UNDSS Security Operations Centre Operators in Aden, Marib, and Al Mokha. The ETC also set up dedicated bandwidth and Wi-Fi connectivity for the UN Mission to support the Hodeidah Agreement in Al-Mokha.
